api_list.api_description: Method that allows you to get a number stating the full quantity of SELECTION icons available at Flaticon. The number refreshes periodically according to the content available at flaticon.com.
Method that allows you to get a paged list with the results of the search. Packs returned by the search may be SELECTION packs or PREMIUM packs, according to the content.

required_parameters.name: q
required_parameters.description: term to search for

required_parameters.name: orderBy
required_parameters.description:
Order by in results from Flaticon API. You can choose between order the results between 'priority' or 'added'. Priority order will return items ordered by an algorithm based on the downloads ratio. Added order will return items ordered by the date they were added to Flaticon.
For example: `https://api.flaticon.com/v2/search/packs/added?q=media&stroke=2&styleName=gradient&packId=1554346&limit=15`

optional_parameters.name: styleName
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by the name of style.

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: Page number

optional_parameters.name: categoryName
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by category name.

optional_parameters.name: iconType
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by icon type, valid values are `standard` and  `stickers`

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Number of max. items returned per request. In case it isn’t requested, it will return 100 packs by default.

optional_parameters.name: familyId
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by family id.

optional_parameters.name: color
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by color id. Color id `1` means monocolor. Color id `2` means multicolor.

optional_parameters.name: tagsId
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by a list of tag ids separated by comma

optional_parameters.name: categoryId
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by category id.

optional_parameters.name: url
optional_parameters.description: pack url to search for

optional_parameters.name: stroke
optional_parameters.description: Filter the results by stroke id. Stroke id `1` means filled. Stroke id `2` means linear.

From this endpoint you can generate a single api key.

api_list.api_description:
Get random proxy,

choose type and country

required_parameters.name: type
required_parameters.description: HTTP, HTTPS, SOCKS4, SOCKS5, CONNECT:25

optional_parameters.name: country
optional_parameters.description: You can specify a country for a proxy that you want to be returened

api_list.api_description:
Tier 2 proxies

Each proxy returned costs 1 credit


With our /v1/tier2 endpoint you can set different parameters for proxies that you need.

You can set type which is just your proxy type, either HTTP, HTTPS, SOCKS4, SOCKS5, CONNECT:25 (which is smtp proxy)

for limit set an integer that will tell us how many proxies you will need. Our users usually set a limit to avoid using too many credits.

With latency you can set an integer which will filter out all proxies that have a latency higher then specified.

ssl is a boolean parameter, you can filter out proxies that support ssl or don't

is_anonymous is also a boolean statemet where you can filter anonymous proxies

country is a parameter that you can use to set a country that you want.

List our tier 1 proxies with filters
This proxies are more comprehensively checked


You can set type which is just your proxy type, either HTTP, HTTPS

for limit set an integer that will tell us how many proxies you will need. Our users usually set a limit to avoid using too many credits.

With latency you can set an integer which will filter out all proxies that have a latency higher then specified.

ssl is a boolean parameter, you can filter out proxies that support ssl or don't

is_anonymous is also a boolean statemet where you can filter anonymous proxies

country is a parameter that you can use to set a country that you want.

required_parameters.name: type
required_parameters.description: HTTP, HTTPS, SOCKS4, SOCKS5, CONNECT:25

optional_parameters.name: latency
optional_parameters.description: ms latency for a proxy, everything that is below that value is returned

optional_parameters.name: country
optional_parameters.description: You can specify a country for a proxy that you want to be returened

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Limit the number of proxies returned, helps you control how many credits can be used

query: I require a tier 2 proxy with low latency and SSL support for my company's data analysis. Can you provide me with a random proxy that is anonymous and located in Germany? Additionally, I need a tier 1 proxy with high speed and located in France.

api_list.api_description: Get currently trending videos.
Get insights about a video, such as related videos.

required_parameters.name: modules
required_parameters.default: A comma-delimited list of one or more insights to request.

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.default: An ID that uniquely identifies a video. The Video object's videoId field contains the ID that you set this parameter to.

api_list.api_description: Get videos relevant for a given query.

required_parameters.name: q
required_parameters.description: The user's search query string

optional_parameters.name: safeSearch
optional_parameters.description: A filter used to filter results for adult content.

optional_parameters.name: mkt
optional_parameters.description:
The market where the results come from. Typically, this is the country where the user is making the request from; however, it could be a different country if the user is not located in a country where Bing delivers results. The market must be in the form -. For example, en-US.

Full list of supported markets:
es-AR, en-AU, de-AT, nl-BE, fr-BE, pt-BR, en-CA, fr-CA, es-CL, da-DK, fi-FI, fr-FR, de-DE, zh-HK, en-IN, en-ID, en-IE, it-IT, ja-JP, ko-KR, en-MY, es-MX, nl-NL, en-NZ, no-NO, zh-CN, pl-PL, pt-PT, en-PH, ru-RU, ar-SA, en-ZA, es-ES, sv-SE, fr-CH, de-CH, zh-TW, tr-TR, en-GB, en-US, es-US

optional_parameters.name: count
optional_parameters.description: The number of video results to return in the response. The actual number delivered may be less than requested.

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: The zero-based offset that indicates the number of video results to skip before returning results.

query: I'm working on a research project and need to find videos related to a specific topic. Can you help me with that? I would like to search for videos relevant to my query using the Video Search API. It would also be helpful to get insights about a video, such as related videos, using the Video Details API.

api_list.api_description: This resource list the variables of a specified data source, showing all the fields of the variables.
This resource returns a variable and its details. It shows additional fields than the ones required during the creation of the variable:  last_value: Shows the last value written to the variable.
Retrieves the list of all the variables owned by a user. The header X-Auth-Token is needed to have the permissions for this endpoint.
This resource lists all the existing data sources of a user.

This resource obtains an existing data source and its details. Also, it returns additional fields besides the ones required during the creation of the data source:  number_of_variables: Shows the number of variables contained by the data source. last_activity: Returns the date of the last activity
This resource returns the values of the specified variable.  Every value will have a timestamp which is a value in milliseconds according to the POSIX standard.

api_list.api_description:
You need a **valid token** to use this endpoint, learn how to get it on this [video](https://youtu.be/TcaAwKpAkl8). 
This endpoint will return the `About` info of the number, and the time when the value was set.

required_parameters.name: phone
required_parameters.description:
The phone number must be written as a number (including countrycode); 
do **NOT** include: any non-number character, spaces, or anything which is not a number; do **NOT** add zeros (0) at the beginning.

required_parameters.name: token
required_parameters.description: To get a free token, click [here](https://wa.me/34631428039?text=get-token) to send a whatsapp with the command `get-token`.

api_list.api_description:
You need a **valid token** to use this endpoint, learn how to get it on this [video](https://youtu.be/TcaAwKpAkl8). 
Requests to this endpoint will return `true` if the number is a **Whatsapp for Business** account, or `false` if it's not.

api_list.api_description:
You need a **valid token** to use this endpoint, learn how to get it on this [video](https://youtu.be/TcaAwKpAkl8). 
The response is `true` if the phone is registered on whatsapp.

required_parameters.name: phone
required_parameters.description:
The phone number must be written as a number (including countrycode); 
do **NOT** include: any non-number character, spaces, or anything which is not a number; do **NOT** add zeros (0) at the beginning.

required_parameters.name: token
required_parameters.description: To get a free token, click [here](https://wa.me/34631428039?text=get-token) to send a whatsapp with the command `get-token`.

api_list.api_description:
enter the number you want to validate.
Learn how to use it on this [video](https://youtu.be/_h5ybzp9UNU).

required_parameters.name: phone
required_parameters.description:
The whatsapp number must be written as: number (including countrycode); do **NOT** include any non-number character, spaces, or anything which is not a number. Otherwise, the request will not be processed.
Examples: of correct numbers are: 34123456789 (for spain) or 491234567890 (for Germany).
TIPS:
    Do NOT include '+' before your countrycode,
    Do NOT include a '-', or any other character or space (anything which is not a number) as part of your phone number.
    If you do not know which is your country code check this: https://countrycode.org/

api_list.api_description: Requests to this endpoint will return `true` if the number is a **Whatsapp for Business** account, or `false` if it's not.

required_parameters.name: phone
required_parameters.description:
The whatsapp number must be written as: `countrycode` and `number`; do NOT include any non-number character, spaces, or anything which is not a number.
Examples: of correct numbers are: `34123456789` (for spain) or `491234567890` (for Germany).
Country codes can be checked here: https://countrycode.org/

api_list.api_description: This endpoint will return the *About* state of the WA number on the query.

query: I want to know if my friend's phone number, 34631428039, is registered on WhatsApp. Can you validate the number and provide the 'About' info? Also, let me know if it is a business account.
